helpMsgs.title: Introduction
helpMsgs.msg:
# MZD-AIO-TI 2.0.0 | Mazda All In One Tweaks Installer **An Installer and uninstaller for 40+ 'Tweaks' For the Mazda MZD Infotainment System** Mazda 2 (DJ), Mazda 3 (BM), Mazda 6 (GJ), Mazda CX-3 (DK), Mazda CX-5 (KE), Mazda MX-5 Roadster (ND) and new 2017 Mazda CX-9 (TC)

Fiat Spider, Toyota ScionA

helpMsgs.title: Tweaking
helpMsgs.msg: #### All changes happen at your own risk! **Please understand that you can damage or brick your infotainment system running these tweaks! Anyone who is unsure should leave it alone, ask someone with experience to help or ask in the forum**. ##### I am not responsible for damages that may incur from the use. Having said that, MZD-AIO-TI was built with saftey in mind so there are 3 saftey levels based on how much or what part of the system is modified: - Safe - Highly tested and accepted as relatively safe - Warning - Modifies sensitive system files or I have not tested myself yet. Mostly safe but use with caution! Most of these will eventually be bumped up to safe. - Development - These are tweaks that are still under development, or just do not work yet. Only Android Auto is currently at this level and recently the issue may be solved.
helpMsgs.msg2:
#### 56.00.100A/230A/240B/511A/512A/513C -ADR (4A N) 

#### 56.00.230A/511A/512A/513B -EU 

#### 55.00.650A/753A/760A / 58.00.250A -NA 

#### 56.00.401A-JP 

##### Only use with FirmWare Versions >= v55. DO NOT USE with V30/31/33 OR YOU WILL BRICK YOUR SYSTEM IT WILL FOREVER STAY LOOPING THE MAZDA BOOT LOGO!  

#### To Be Safe, For now AIO-TI Will Automatically Abort The Installation If No Compadible Firmware Version Is Found.  

###### To overide this you have to be comfortable editing tweaks.sh directly, find the code that preforms the firmware check and disable or ad your version to the list of Compatible firmwares.  **Do This At Your Own Risk!**

helpMsgs.title: Reverting
helpMsgs.msg:
**Almost all the tweaks** can be uninstalled to revert to the system default state.
Default Background: ![Default Background](../background-images/default/default.png )
- AIO creates backups of all the files that it modifies and uses those backups when reverting. AIO also contains an original version of each file just in case any of the backup files are missing. In future versions I plan to include an option to copy and store your own system's backup files into AIO as a failsafe to ensure compatability for future CMD versions. - In general, for all Compatible CMD versions it is safe to run uninstalls of tweaks that have not been installed BUT keep in mind that AIO will overwrite the files involved with the included failsafe backups because it will not find any available backups in the system. So try to avoid running uninstallers for tweaks that you have not installed.
helpMsgs.t2: What Parts Of The System Are Not Reverted By AIO?
helpMsgs.msg2:
#### **MZD-AIO-TI modifies some files in the system that cannot be reverted back using this app.** 

These first 3 files honestly should never be reverted because a mistake in one of these files will result in a unrecoverable bootloop.  They are only modified to disable the system from triggering a reboot on error and consequently creating a bootloop, so reverting them would put your system at a high risk. **Only the first time** the installer runs on your system they are backed up modified.

- /jci/sm/sm.conf (This file gets modified by the Android )
- /jci/opera/opera_home/opera.ini 
- /jci/opera/opera_dir/userjs/fps.js

##### These 2 tweaks have no uninstall, they should have been enabled.

- Wifi (NA Region)
- ssh_bringback for 56.00.511A/512A/513B-EU

helpMsgs.title: Troubleshooting
helpMsgs.msg:
Here are some common errors with ways to avoid them. 
#### If you keep hitting errors and/or hang ups:
 - The most common issue is a file system access error: resource busy or locked.  This occurs when a file or directory cannot be modified becasue it is open or being used by another program. While compiling, close all folders and documents especially files that are actively being used by MZD-AIO-TI (*ex: '_copy_to_usb'*)
 - Try selcting fewer tweaks at a time, picking too many increases the chaces for an unexpected error. 
 - If the installer does not start in the car try reformatting your USB drive as FAT32 and make sure all other USB devices are disconnected. It helps to turn bluetooth off too. NAV SD card should be left in.
helpMsgs.t2: If you are having Video Player Issues
helpMsgs.msg2:
Try:

- Place your videos in a folder named 'Movies'! 

- Unplug all other USB drives, especially one, with much MP3s on it 

- Copy only one mp3 on your video USB drive 

- Copy only a few videos on your stick (you don't have to delete, rename to *._mp4 is OK too, so that they will not found anymore) 

- Reboot your system and try to play a video right after that 

- Close the player and start again 

- If that doesn't work, then change the audio input.

- After that: use H264 video codec and MPEG-4 AAC audio codec in video files

- Videos can be: MP4, AVI, FLV, WMV

helpMsgs.title: Known Issues
helpMsgs.msg:
- Swapfile is 1 GB and may fail when copying to USB.
- If there is not enough space free on the USB drive, you will hang up while copying to USB drive. This may happen if you are copying the swapfile on a drive that is almost full. I plan to fix this in a future version and have an error message pop up.
- The Speedcam Patch doesn't quite work yet.  I am in contact with Modfreakz and he will send me an updated patching tool soon.

helpMsgs.title: Tips & Tricks
helpMsgs.msg: I will include some tips that go above and beyond this app.
helpMsgs.msg2: This app is built with Electron and AngularJS

FAQs.title: FAQ
FAQs.q1: Is AIO compatible with my FW version?
FAQs.a1: All compatible FW versions are listed in the 'Tweaking > Compatible Firmware Versions' section to the left in this help panel.  MZD-AIO-TI will read out your FW version at beginning of installation and show if itâ€™s not compatible (or not yet tested) and you will abort the installation at this point, for saftey.
FAQs.q2: How long does it take till the installation starts?
FAQs.a2: Tipically installation will start whithin 30 seconds to 2 minutes but it can take up to 10 minutes to begin.
FAQs.q3: If something goes wrong, how can I help you to help me?
FAQs.a3: During installation/uninstallation, a log file is created (AIO log.txt & MZD-AIO-TI info.txt) and some additional files will be copied on the USB drive. Please make a ZIP file of them (complete root of USB drive) and send that to me or upload it somewhere (e.g. google drive or so) and send me the link. Or you can download this tweak that will copy some files from your MZD system to the USB drive and send those.
FAQs.q4: Do I have to uninstall a tweak with AIO 1.x before installing it again?
FAQs.a4: No, You can install every tweak with AIO, you never have to uninstall before. MZD-AIO-TI 2.x use the same tweaks AIO 1.x and compatability was taken into consideration.
FAQs.q5: How long does the installation/uninstallation take?
FAQs.a5: Up to 10 minutes if every tweak has been selected (especially custom colors and speedcam-patch). Preforming a backup of your JCI folder can also take up to 10 minutes by itself so with everything up to 20 minutes.
FAQs.q6: What if I want to revert my system but I forgot the tweaks I've installed?
FAQs.a6: Uninstalling tweaks is safe in general, if the uninstaller dosn't find a backup, it will copy the original files from USB drive over your original files of your MZD system BUT: YOU SHOULD NOT DO THIS FOR NEW AND UNKNOWN FW VERSIONS! See: 'Reverting' section of this help panel.
FAQs.q7: I want to change the order of the audio sources?
FAQs.a7:
Edit: /jci/gui/apps/system/js/systemApp.js on lines 624 - 637

* Be careful, the last line must not end with a comma, or you run in to boot loop! *
I am working on modifying the tweak to give the option to make your own order without manually modifying any files.
FAQs.q8: Can I install AIO from an SD card?
FAQs.a8: No. SD card slot in the car is ONLY for satnav maps. You need to use USB port in the car, so either USB stick or USB-SD card reader with your card in it.
FAQs.q9: How do I a reboot the MZD system?
FAQs.q10: Can you write this or that tweak for us?
FAQs.a10: I have improved on many of the existing tweaks and tweaks.sh as a whole but I do have a job and Developing the GUI for this app is a pretty hefty task. That being said, I will take suggestions for future tweaks but no promises. You can contact me with the contact link on the bottom right of the app.

tourMsgs.msg:
Welcome to MZD-AIO-TI!


Mazda All In One Tweaks Installer

An Installer And Uninstaller for 40+ 'Tweaks' For the Mazda MZD Infotainment System.
These are the main Tweaks. You can choose to install or uninstall for each.
This sidebar will list all the tweaks currently selected.  Here will appear extra options and you can also click any item in this list for help information.
Additional actions such as backup jci folder & enable wifi for North American versions.
These options can be restored to original state by selecting their default options.
The menus have more help topics and links to resources and documentation.
When all your tweaks have been selected, click this button to compile and go!
For more information visit MazdaTweaks.win!

backup.label: Backup JCI Folder
backup.toolTip:
Backup JCI
Do backup of JCI folder before installing tweaks.

background.label: Background Image
background.toolTip:
Background
Change your Infotainment background to your own custom image. Supported image formats are: jpg, jpeg, and png (any size). Note: If single img is chosen, the image will be resized to 800px x 480px BUT NOT CROPPED and converted .png format. To change the background image back to original, choose 'Default Background.

colors.label: Custom Infotainment Colors
colors.toolTip:
Custom Color Schemes
Changes your Infotainment color scheme from Red (default) to one the following colors:
  • Blue
  • Green
  • Orange
  • Pink
  • Purple
  • Silver
  • Yellow
  • carOS

sshbringback.label: Install SSH_bringback (f. 56.00.51x)
sshbringback.toolTip:
SSH_bringback
**No removing possible!** With FW 56.00.511 Mazda has removed SSH access. With SSH_bringback this will be reinstalled. This tweak will still only be installed if FW 56.00.511 is recognized, if it's 56.00.230, nothing happens.

sdcid.label: SD CID
sdcid.toolTip:
SD CID
Gets the CID from the Nav SD card if available.

backgroundrotator.label: Background Rotator
backgroundrotator.button: Click To Join Images For Your Background To Rotate Through
backgroundrotator.toolTip:
Background Rotator Tweak.
Cycles through 10 Backgrounds over 10 minutes (600 seconds - 60 seconds per background). Note: After installing this tweak, you can change your joined background multiple times without installing again. To Revert back to a single background uninstall this tweak.

retain.label: Retain Backups
retain.toolTip: ##### Retain Backups  Keep backup files in your system when uninstalling tweaks.  Checked by default, **unchecking will delete backup files on tweak uninstalls.**

advanced.label: Advanced Options
advanced.toolTip:
Advanced Options
These are tweaks that are under development or somehow known to be unsafe. If you dont know what you are doing, its best to stick with safe highly tested options. USE WITH CAUTION, YOU CAN BRICK YOUR SYSTEM IF YOU ARE NOT CAREFUL!

shorterdelay.label: Shorter Delay Mod
shorterdelay.toolTip:
Shorter Delay Mod

Reduces the waiting time switching between pages with the multi commander from 1.5 to 0.3 seconds.

installall.label: Install All
installall.toolTip: Install All Except: Android Auto and Castscreen.

imgOps.label: Join multiple images for your infotainment background
Select 10, 480px X 800px Images (Each Image will be resized to 480x800). Background Rotator Rotates 10 Images in 10 Minutes. More options coming soon..
You need to choose 10 images to join (Each image should be height: 480px, width: 800px) or
This image wil replace your infotainment background.
Right-click > Save Image saves a copy of background.png to your downloads folder.

translatorWindow.label: Enter Language Name (file will save as
This section was designed for easily translating this app into many languages.
Choose a translation file to edit
Enter name of the translated language

opac.label: Black Background Opacity? (To Reduce Visibility of Custom MZD Background Image) 0.0 (Fully Transparent) - 1.0 (Completely Black)

tweakOps.DEINST: Disable the touchscreen again while moving
tweakOps.toolTip:
Touchscreen
Allows the use of the touchscreen while driving.

No More Disclaimer
Completely remove the disclaimer or reduce the expansion time of the disclaimer from 3.5 to 0.5 seconds.

tweakOps.INST: Remove the reverse camera safety warning
tweakOps.DEINST: Restore the safety warning label to the reverse camera
tweakOps.toolTip:
Reverse Camera Safety Warning
No security warning at the bottom when activating the rear camera.

tweakOps.DEINST: Remove semi-transp. parking sensor graphics f. proximity sensors
tweakOps.toolTip:
Semi-Transparent Parking Sensor Graphics.
Semitransparent parking sensor graphics for proximity sensors.. When activating the rear camera, the car is displayed at the top right corner.#The graphics now appear semitransparent by installing tweak.

Main Menu Loop.
Loop for the main menu.
You can jump from left to far right, and vice versa.

Improved List Loop.
Loop for all lists and submenu (music, contacts, etc.).
You can now jump from the top position of a list to the bottom and vice versa.
Uninstalling this mod will also uninstall Shorter Delay Mod. This can be avoided by selecting to install Shorter Delay Mod in the same tweak build.

Shorter Delay Mod.
Reduces the waiting time for switching between pages with the multi commander from 1.5 to 0.3 seconds.
Uninstalling Improved List Loop will also uninstall this mod.

tweakOps.INST: Enable media_order patch and FLAC support
tweakOps.toolTip:
Media Order Patching and FLAC Support
Music will be sorted alphabetically and not by date with new entries first. Support for audio format FLAC.

tweakOps.INST: Change order of the audio source list
tweakOps.DEINST: Restore order of audio source list back to original
tweakOps.toolTip:
Change Order of the Audio Source List.
The order of the audio source list is arranged as follows:.
  • FMRadio
  • DAB
  • USB_A
  • USB_B
  • btaudio
  • CD
  • SatRadio
  • AhaRadio
  • Pandora
  • StitcherAuxIn
  • amradio
  • DVD
  • TV

Pause On Mute.
When pressing mute (pressing the volume button) played media are also paused.

Remove Message Replies
Removes the text 'Sent from my Mazda Quick Text System' if answering messages.

1 Sec Diag Menu
Allows you to open the diagnostic menu by touching the clock at the top right of the display settings menu for one second.

Boot Animation
The boot animation that leads to the menu with the red buttons will be disabled.

tweakOps.DEINST: Album art cover back to original
tweakOps.toolTip:
Bigger Album Art
You get a bigger album art graphic.

tweakOps.DEINST: Background behind buttons back to original
tweakOps.toolTip:
No Background Behind Buttons
Remove the background behind the buttons.

tweakOps.INST: Remove the blank album art frame
tweakOps.DEINST: Restore the blank album art frame
tweakOps.toolTip:
Change Blank Album Art Frame
The empty album cover frame is removed, which is displayed when there is no entry in the Gracenote database for the artist. Then the image of a radio is displayed, if there is no cover in the MP3 tag too. Supported image formats are: jpg, jpeg, and png (any size). Note: The image chosen will be resized to 146px x 146px BUT NOT CROPPED and converted .png format

Videoplayer
Add videoplayer app to the application menu.

tweakOps.INST: Generate swapfile for media player v2
tweakOps.toolTip:
Swapfile
The installation of the swap file must be done on a USB drive with music and/or movies, that remains in the car.. The installation files are automatically deleted, the drive may no longer be removed during operation, because the system will use it also as memory.. Only remove the USB drive if the MZD system is off.

Speedometer With Compass in the Application Menu.
  • Below the speedometer is km/h or mph, depending on the setting
  • Speed range up to 240 km/h
  • Consumption values
  • Optimized graphics modules with new speedometer pointer
  • Small speedometer needle for top speed in the analog part
  • The picture for the speedometer scale has different lengths or bright lines for 5, 10 and 20 km/h jumps
  • Right table english or german German and color / size optimized
  • All numbers have a slight shadow around to better stand out from the background.
  • On travel direction rotating compass central to the current speed
  • Animated overlay in the status with GPS speed and direction of travel in each menu can be prepared by touch at the clock
  • Latitude and longitude in the right table
  • When the Navi or Rear Camera is started, it automatically appears

For the small speedo in the status bar you have to install date_to_statusbar mod V2.2 too. Therefore it will be automatically selected, if not already done.

Date In Status Bar Mod.
Permanently visible date + icons by the clock, even if system messages are displayed.

Fuel Consumption Tweak.
Additional display of KM / L (or MPG).

Speedcam Patch.
The navigation is so patched so that database for speed cameras are accepted.. You can then copy a file 'speedcam.txt' on the SD card for the navigation, which will be imported.

Castscreen receiver.
After installation you can mirror the smartphone screen at the infotainment display (mirroring).
  • You have to install the castscreen app on your Android Phone (castscreen-1.0.apk) The app can be found in the 'config' folder of your USB drive
  • activate the debug mode on your smartphone
  • connect the smartphone with USB cable to the infotainment system
  • start the app settings: H264, 800x480 @ 160, 1 mbps, then input 127.0.0.1 and press input receiver, then tap Start on right-up corner.
.

Android Car Headunit app. Android car for the infotainment system.

1. Install the Android app from google play store:HERE.
2. Connect the phone to USB and pair the phone bluetooth with the CMU
3. Manually switch to Bluetooth Audio Input.
4. Click on the AA icon under Applications Menu on the CMU
5. A black screen with credits should open up first and input
6. Android Auto will then start. If it does not, pull out the USB and start over again (or check the installation.)
7. 2 ways to stop AA - Disconnect the USB cable or use the onscreen menu 'Return to Mazda Connect' on last screen with speedo icon..
8. Once disconnected, the back screen will remain. Press Home Button on the Mazda's Commander to close it. I had to do this because js double click wasn't working..
**What does not work:**
1. Reverse camera gets blacked out.
2. Voice Control
3. Touch drag / multi touch
4. Google Maps night mode always on.
